page.title: 06HOUSING,DONNINGTON,TELFORD
page.content: Many houses in Donnington have flat rooves.They were built during World War II when there was a shortage of wood.They have recently been insulated and retiled. The houses are either in sets of four or are semi-detached.Most of the homes in the area are council houses. The Jubilee Avenue estate was built in 1935.These houses have been modernised in the last few years.The most recent council houses to be built are those around Coronation Drive and The Common which were built in the 1960s.Elderly people are well catered for.Bungalows at Lawndale are set in open plan gardens with a hall on the site.Although close to a busy road,it is very quiet there.Summercroft, on Church Road,is a single storey home for people who need a little nursing help.Across the road is Willow Court,a block of flats for the elderly.
